Objects

Objects are containers for fields. In the example below, an object OBJ has three properties: foo, bar, and baz

If a property has no value set (like baz below), it is displayed as a circle: . You can click this circle to turn it into a cell.

The black dot above the object () represents a state, which we'll discuss later.

Set OBJ.baz to this.bar+1. Then, try creating a new object named OBJ_2 and give it a property
